about.name: Nathan M. Shea
about.bio: Hi, I’m Nathan, a junior at Boston College studying computer science with a minor in finance. I’m passionate about problem-solving, logic, and finding cross-sector solutions for real-world challenges.

news.title: Studying Abroad in Athens
news.content: I will be studying abroad in Athens, Greece in the spring of 2025 at the American College of Greece.

news.title: Mount Washington Summit
news.content: I recently summited Mount Washington over fall break.

news.title: Completion of final Web Dev project
news.content: See Project 3 to read more about my Web Application Development final called Eagle Eye. A website to help BC students locate on-campus amenities and resources.

news.title: End of Junior Year Fall Semester At BC
news.content: Leaving Campus and heading home for the holidays after another great semester at BC. My completed classes were the following: Algorithms, Web Application Development, Corperate Finance, The Everlasting Convenatant (Theology Core), and Family Sociology (Social Science Core).

projects.title: Project 1: Beacon CRM Data Analysis
projects.short_description: This project involved analyzing data from Beacon CRM, providing insights on stakeholder patterns, and managing bio information for Holomua Collective.

details.title: Project 1: Beacon CRM Data Analysis
details.description: During my internship with the Holomua Collective, I worked extensively with the Beacon CRM system to analyze data from various stakeholders. My role involved identifying key patterns, managing contact and bio information, and producing insights that helped shape the collective’s strategic initiatives.

projects.title: Project 2: Cross-Sector Collaboration Website
projects.short_description: Designed a collaborative website for private businesses, nonprofits, and government sectors to address systemic issues together. This was for my internship with the Holomua Collective

details.title: Project 2: Cross-Sector Collaboration Website
details.description: One of the major projects I worked on involved designing and developing a website for the Holomua Collective’s cross-sector convening sessions. The goal was to provide a platform for private businesses, nonprofits, and government sectors to collaborate and address systemic issues. The website included interactive features and resources for all participants.

projects.title: Project 3: 'Eagle Eye' Campus Navigation Website
projects.short_description: Developed a campus resource locator to help BC students find vending machines, study rooms, emergency services and other campus amenities.

details.title: Project 3: Eagle Eye Web App
details.description: As part of a group project in Web Application Development, I developed Eagle Eye, a campus resource locator web app. This project aimed to assist BC students in finding campus amenities like vending machines, study lounges, and bathrooms using an interactive map interface built with Google Maps API. Visit the Eagle Eye Website
